item.title: On Congress Attacks Over Manmohan Singh Funeral, JP Nadda's 'Super PM' Swipe - NDTV
item.description:
On Congress Attacks Over Manmohan Singh Funeral, JP Nadda's 'Super PM' Swipe

Date: New Delhi
Source: News Article

Following the cremation of former Prime Minister Dr. Manmohan Singh, Congress leaders Rahul and Priyanka Gandhi criticized the BJP for 'insulting' his memory. BJP President JP Nadda accused Congress of playing 'cheap politics' regarding the former PM's funeral arrangements.

  • Dr. Singh was cremated with full state honours at Nigambodh Ghat in Delhi.
  • Congress demanded a memorial site befitting Dr. Singh's stature, which they believe was not honored by the BJP.
  • Rahul Gandhi stated the BJP 'totally insulted' Dr. Singh by choosing the cremation site.
  • JP Nadda defended the government's decisions, arguing that space for a memorial would be allocated.
  • The controversy highlights ongoing political tensions surrounding the legacy of Manmohan Singh.
Rahul Gandhi: "Dr Manmohan Singh deserves our highest respect and a memorial. The government should have shown respect..."

The incident reflects the deep political divide in India regarding the reverence shown to former leaders, particularly in the context of the late Dr. Singh's legacy.

item.title: Video: In A First, Israel Uses US Anti-Missile THAAD system To Counter Houthi Attack - News18
item.description:
Israel Deploys THAAD System for First Time Against Houthi Missile Attack

Date: December 28, 2024 | Source: News18

In a significant military development, Israel successfully engaged a ballistic missile launched from Yemen by Houthi rebels using the U.S. Terminal High Altitude Area Defense (THAAD) system. This marks the first recorded use of THAAD by Israel.

  • THAAD was deployed in Israel in October 2024.
  • American soldier footage shows the THAAD interceptor launch, highlighting the anticipation of success after many years.
  • The Israeli Defense Forces confirmed the interception, although not the specifics of THAAD's involvement.
  • THAAD is designed to intercept various missile ranges and relies on kinetic energy for neutralization.
  • The deployment follows multiple Houthi missile attacks targeting Israel, notably Ben Gurion Airport.
“Eighteen years I’ve been waiting for this.” - American soldier during THAAD test

This event underlines the escalating military tensions in the region, especially with continued Houthi aggression against Israel.

item.title: Vijay Sales' Apple Days Sale: Big discounts on iPhone 16 Pro Max, MacBook Pro Series and more | Mint - Mint
item.description:
Vijay Sales’ Apple Days Sale: Big discounts on iPhone 16 Pro Max, MacBook Pro Series and more

Date: 29 December 2024 - 5 January 2025

Source: Live Mint

The year-end shopping season brings significant discounts on a variety of Apple products during Vijay Sales’ Apple Days Sale, including iPhones, MacBooks, iPads, and more.

  • iPhone 16 Pro available for ₹106,900, discounted from ₹119,900.
  • iPhone 16 Pro Max 256GB priced at ₹130,650, with an effective offer price of ₹127,650.
  • iPhone 15 128GB available for ₹60,490, further reduced to ₹57,490.
  • MacBook Air with M3 chip starting at ₹103,390, discounted to ₹93,390.
  • iPad 10th Gen priced at ₹32,499, further reduced to ₹29,499.
  • Clearance discounts on open-box units starting at ₹32,900 for iPhone 13.
  • Partnerships with major banks offer instant discounts of up to ₹10,000.
“Shoppers who participate in the MyVS loyalty programme can earn points equivalent to 0.75 per cent of their total purchase value.”

In conclusion, the Apple Days Sale provides an excellent opportunity for Apple fans to purchase their favorite products at reduced prices, along with additional bank and loyalty discounts.

item.title: Varun Dhawan's Baby John shows being replaced by Hindi version of Unni Mukundan's Marco: Report - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Varun Dhawan's Baby John Faces Replacement by Marco's Hindi Version

Date: Dec 28, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Varun Dhawan's film Baby John, which premiered on Christmas, is struggling at the box office, while the Malayalam film Marco is garnering positive attention and replacing Baby John's shows.

  • Baby John has not performed well since its release.
  • Marco, starring Unni Mukundan, has been well-received and is set to replace shows of Baby John in North India.
  • Marco has collected ₹29.9 crore net in India and ₹57 crore worldwide.
  • Baby John has earned ₹19.65 crore net in India and ₹27.60 crore worldwide.
  • The violent nature of Marco has drawn significant curiosity among audiences.
“There’s a curiosity to see it (Marco)... it is touted to be one of India’s most violent films.”

The replacement of shows indicates a shift in audience preference and highlights the competitive nature of current Bollywood releases.

item.title: Marathi actress Urmila Kothare's car accidentally hits metro workers in Mumbai; one killed - TOI Etimes
item.description:
Marathi actress Urmila Kothare's car accidentally hits metro workers in Mumbai; one killed

Publication Date: December 23, 2023 Source: Times of India

A car owned by Marathi actress Urmila Kothare accidentally hit two metro workers near Kandivali in Mumbai, resulting in one death and severe injuries to another worker. Kothare and her driver were also injured in the incident.

  • The accident took place near Poisar Metro station while Urmila was returning from a film shoot.
  • One worker died at the scene, the other is hospitalized.
  • The police stated that the car was speeding and lost control.
  • A case has been filed against the driver, and an investigation is underway.
“Urmila avoided serious injuries thanks to the timely deployment of the car’s airbags.”

This tragic event follows another incident in Mumbai where a six-year-old boy was fatally injured by an airbag during a car crash.

item.title: Donald Trump Supporters Are No Longer Fans Of Elon Musk. Reason? Immigration - News18
item.description:
Donald Trump Supporters Are No Longer Fans Of Elon Musk. Reason? Immigration

Date: December 28, 2024

Source: News18

Supporters of US President-elect Donald Trump are expressing discontent over comments made by Elon Musk on immigration policies, particularly merit-based reforms, which contradict the anti-immigration stance of many Trump supporters.

  • Elon Musk advocates for attracting global talent to maintain US technological dominance.
  • Criticism arose following the appointment of Sriram Krishnan to lead AI policy in Trump’s administration.
  • Comments made by conservative figures have sparked controversy within Trump’s supporter circles.
“If you want your TEAM to win the championship, you need to recruit top talent wherever they may be.” - Elon Musk

The conversation surrounding immigration highlights a significant rift between Elon Musk's viewpoints and those of Trump's base.

item.title: Pushpa 2 Hindi Box Office Day 23: Record-Breaking Spree Continues As It Beats Uri & Baahubali 2 To Achieve A New Milestone! - Koimoi
item.description:
Pushpa 2 Hindi Box Office Day 23: Record-Breaking Spree Continues

Publication Date: [Date not provided]Source: Koimoi

Allu Arjun led Pushpa 2 continues its rock-solid hold at the Hindi box office. It has entered its fourth week, and the daily collections have gone below the 10 crore mark. The action thriller has achieved yet another milestone in India.

  • Day 23 earnings: 7.50 crores
  • Overall box office collection now stands at 747.75 crores
  • Pushpa 2 is only 2.25 crores away from the 750 crore mark, the first ever for a Hindi film.
  • Achieved the highest day 23 earnings in Hindi cinema history, surpassing Baahubali 2, Uri, and Jawan.
  • Return on investment reported at 273.62%
“The record-breaking spree seems never-ending for Pushpa 2: The Rule.”

This successful run showcases the film's significant impact on the box office, making history with its earnings.

item.title: Modi government ‘insulted’ Manmohan Singh by cremating him at Nigambodh Ghat, charges Congress - The Hindu
item.description:
Congress Accuses Modi Government of Insulting Manmohan Singh at His Funeral

Date: December 28, 2024

Source: The Hindu

The opposition Congress party has accused the Modi government of insulting former Prime Minister Manmohan Singh by not allocating a separate place for his funeral.

  • Rahul Gandhi stated the government insulted Dr. Singh, a significant leader.
  • Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge requested the government to designate a memorial site for Singh.
  • The government claims a decision to set up a memorial has been made.
  • Criticism arose regarding the treatment of Dr. Singh’s family during the cremation.
“The great son of Mother India and the first Prime Minister of the Sikh community, Dr. Manmohan Singh ji has been totally insulted by the present government...” - Rahul Gandhi

The article highlights the political tension surrounding Dr. Singh's last rites and the implications for his legacy.

item.title: 'This is the last time he will bat at 7': Ravi Shastri pushes for Nitish Reddy’s batting order promotion - The Times of India
item.description:
Ravi Shastri Advocates for Nitish Reddy’s Promotion in Batting Order

Publication Date: October 2023 Source: Times of India

This article discusses Ravi Shastri's recommendation for Nitish Reddy to be promoted in the batting order, emphasizing the strategic importance of this change.

  • Shastri believes Reddy's talent is underutilized at the current batting position.
  • Promotion could enhance team performance based on statistical analysis.
  • The move aligns with the team's goals for upcoming matches.
“This is the last time he will bat at 7” - Ravi Shastri

Shastri's insights reflect a crucial strategic shift that could influence future games positively.

item.title: This essential vitamin can reduce dementia and diabetes risk - The Times of India
item.description:
Vitamin D Linked to Reduced Risk of Dementia and Diabetes

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

Recent studies highlight the significant health benefits of Vitamin D, including its role in maintaining cognitive function and reducing risks related to dementia and diabetes.

  • A study linked Vitamin D deficiency to a higher risk of Alzheimer's disease, finding that nearly 50% of the population may be at risk for dementia.
  • Research involving 270,000 participants revealed that regular intake of Vitamin D can lower the risk of developing Alzheimer's by 17%.
  • Vitamin D is crucial for brain health and may mitigate dementia risks through various biological mechanisms.
  • Another study found a connection between Vitamin D deficiency and an increased risk of diabetes, even in those managing blood sugar levels.
“Vitamin D regulates insulin levels and plays a protective role against brain inflammation.”

To enhance Vitamin D intake, individuals are advised to seek sunlight exposure, take supplements, and consume Vitamin D-rich foods.

item.title: 'Squid Games meets Bigg Boss': Salman Khan's Sikandar teaser drop has an SRK connect and fans can't keep calm - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Salman Khan's Sikandar Teaser Drops

Publication Date: Dec 28, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

The official teaser for Salman Khan's upcoming film Sikandar has finally been released, generating excitement among fans. The teaser showcases Khan in an action-packed montage, reminiscent of popular shows like 'Squid Game' and 'Bigg Boss'.

  • Teaser release followed an unexpected delay due to the demise of former PM Manmohan Singh.
  • Fans celebrated the teaser as a comeback for Salman Khan after his recent underwhelming performances.
  • The teaser hints at stunning visuals, with VFX handled by Shah Rukh Khan's Red Chillies Entertainment.
  • Film directed by AR Murugadoss, produced by Sajid Nadiadwala, featuring Rashmika Mandanna and Kajal Aggarwal.
  • Sikandar is set to release around Eid 2025.
“This looks really good, finally something worth Salman's stardom.”

With the buzz generated by the teaser, there is great anticipation for Sikandar, and fans are eager to see Salman Khan back in his element.

item.title: 'We followed the rules, Magnus Carlsen didn't': FIDE deputy prez Viswanathan Anand - The Times of India
item.description:
We followed the rules, Magnus Carlsen didn't: FIDE deputy prez Viswanathan Anand

Publication Date: Recent
Source: Times of India

In a recent statement, FIDE deputy president and chess legend Viswanathan Anand emphasized the adherence to rules in light of Magnus Carlsen's behavior during competitive events.

  • Anand stressed the importance of following the established norms by players.
  • He expressed disappointment over Carlsen's actions, suggesting they undermine the integrity of the game.
  • Anand called for greater accountability and transparency within the sport to maintain its reputation.
“Players must respect the rules to ensure fairness and integrity in competition.”

The remarks highlight ongoing discussions around player conduct and the necessity of maintaining stringent standards in chess.

item.title: Nitish Kumar Reddy Rewarded With Massive Cash Prize From Andhra Cricket Association - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Nitish Kumar Reddy Rewarded With Massive Cash Prize From Andhra Cricket Association

Date: December 28, 2024 | Source: NDTV

The Andhra Cricket Association has awarded a cash prize of Rs 25 lakh to Nitish Kumar Reddy in recognition of his impressive Test performance, which played a significant role in India's comeback during the Boxing Day Test in Melbourne.

  • The ACA announced a cash prize of Rs 25 lakh for Reddy.
  • Reddy scored an unbeaten 105 runs, helping India reach 358 for nine.
  • His performance was instrumental in India's fightback in the fourth Test at the Melbourne Cricket Ground.
  • Reddy has been highlighted as a standout player in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy.
  • Cricket legends praised his innings, with Sunil Gavaskar calling it one of the greatest Test knocks.
"It is a fortunate day and a happiest moment for the Andhra Cricket Association," said ACA President Kesineni Sivanath.

Nitish Kumar Reddy's achievement not only highlights his talent but also brings pride to the region, marking a significant milestone in his cricketing career.

item.title: 'That's why you're not head coach': Australian legends in heated debate over Rishabh Pant's dismissal - The Times of India
item.description:
Debate Erupts Over Rishabh Pant's Dismissal in Boxing Day Test

Publication Date: Date Not Specified | Source: Times of India

The dismissal of Rishabh Pant during the Boxing Day Test at the MCG has sparked intense discussions among Australian cricket legends regarding his shot selection.

  • Rishabh Pant attempted a scoop shot but was caught, leading to disagreements among commentators.
  • Mark Waugh criticized Pant's shot selection, citing game situation and risks involved.
  • Michael Hussey defended Pant's playing style, advocating for players' freedom to play audacious shots.
  • Michael Vaughan supported Hussey's stance, praising Pant's talent.
  • The debate highlighted differing coaching philosophies on aggressive play and shot selection.
Mark Waugh: "That's unacceptable... there were two men back for that exact shot."
Michael Hussey: "That's the way he likes to play... it is a poor shot, don't get me wrong."

This discussion reflects the tension between maintaining aggressive batting styles and adhering to strategic play in cricket.

item.title: Putin apologises for downing Azerbaijan Airlines plane, says Russia was repelling Ukranian drone attacks - The Indian Express
item.description:
Putin Apologizes for Azerbaijan Airlines Plane Crash Amidst Ukrainian Drone Attacks

Date: December 25, 2024

Source: Indian Express

The Kremlin acknowledged that the Russian air defense forces were responding to Ukrainian drone attacks when an Azerbaijan Airlines plane attempted to land in Grozny, resulting in a tragic crash that claimed 38 lives.

  • The plane was on a scheduled flight from Baku to Grozny on Christmas Day.
  • It crashed near Aktau in Kazakhstan after losing control due to apparent interference.
  • President Putin expressed condolences to Azerbaijani President Ilham Aliyev, calling the incident tragic.
  • The US had indicated that the Russian air defense may be responsible for the downing of the aircraft.
  • Azerbaijan's presidential office reported that the plane faced external physical interference in Russian airspace.
“(President) Vladimir Putin apologised for the tragic incident that occurred in Russian airspace.”

The incident raises significant concerns regarding air safety in conflict zones, particularly in light of ongoing tensions between Russia and Ukraine.

item.title: 'Russian air defence active when plane crashed': Russian President Putin 'apologises' to Azerbaijan count - The Times of India
item.description:
Russian air defence active when plane crashed: Putin apologises to Aliyev

Publication Date: [Insert Date Here] Source: [Insert Source Here]

Russian President Vladimir Putin has expressed his apologies to Azerbaijan's President Ilham Aliyev following a recent plane crash incident. The claims suggest that Russian air defense systems were active at the time, raising concerns about safety protocols.

  • Putin conveyed his sentiments during a phone call with Aliyev.
  • The incident has drawn attention due to the involvement of Russian military technology.
  • This apology aims to maintain diplomatic relations between Russia and Azerbaijan.
“We deeply regret the unfortunate incident and are committed to ensuring this doesn’t happen again,” President Putin stated.

This incident highlights the importance of military protocol adherence and raises significant questions about the operational state of air defense systems in conflict regions.

item.title: 'Dangerous attack': WHO chief Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus shares video of narrow escape from Israeli attac - The Times of India
item.description:
WHO Chief Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus Survives Close Call from Israeli Attack in Yemen

Publication Date: October 2023

Source: [Source Name]

In a recent incident, WHO Director-General Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus narrowly escaped an Israeli attack while in Yemen, an event he described as dangerous and alarming.

  • Tedros shared a video documenting the moment of the attack.
  • The WHO is deeply concerned about the impact of violence in Yemen on health services.
  • The incident highlights ongoing tensions in the region affecting humanitarian efforts.
“This is a dangerous situation for all those who are trying to provide care in conflict zones.”

This incident underscores the perilous conditions under which health workers are operating in Yemen.

item.title: Marathi actor Urmila Kothare’s car runs over 2 workers in Kandivali; 1 killed - The Indian Express
item.description:
Marathi actor Urmila Kothare’s car runs over 2 workers in Kandivali; 1 killed

Publication Date: Early Saturday morning

Source: Indian Express

In a tragic incident, Marathi actor Urmila Kothare’s vehicle struck two labourers working at a Metro construction site, resulting in one fatality and one injury.

  • The accident occurred around 12:45 AM near Poisar Metro station in Kandivali.
  • Kothare was reportedly heading home after dropping off a friend in Jogeshwari.
  • The driver has been booked for rash and negligent driving.
  • One labourer died at the scene, while the other was injured and is receiving treatment.
  • Both Kothare and her driver also sustained injuries.
“She had just wrapped up her shooting and was returning home when the incident took place,” a police officer said.

This incident raises concerns about road safety and the responsibilities of drivers.

item.title: ‘Deceptive politics’: BJP slams Rahul Gandhi over X post on Manmohan Singh - Hindustan Times
item.description:
BJP Criticizes Rahul Gandhi Over Comments on Manmohan Singh's Funeral

Date: Dec 28, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) has rebuffed Congress leader Rahul Gandhi's accusations of disrespecting former Prime Minister Manmohan Singh following Singh's funeral at Nigambodh Ghat, a public cremation site.

  • The BJP criticized Gandhi for “politicizing” Singh's death.
  • Gandhi stated Singh was insulted by conducting his last rites in a public location.
  • The Congress party has called for a memorial to honor Singh's legacy.
“The kind of deceptive politics Congress has engaged in... is unfortunate.” - BJP MP Sambit Patra

The BJP assured that a memorial will be constructed in remembrance of Singh, while Congress continues to contest the location of his cremation.

item.title: Telcos investment recovery in limbo as tariff hike backfires, price war with satcom services likely in 202 - The Economic Times
item.description:
Telcos investment recovery in limbo as tariff hike backfires, price war with satcom services likely in 2024

Publication Date: December 31, 2023
Source: Economic Times

Telecom operators in India are grappling with significant challenges in 2024 as they face a loss of subscribers due to unsuccessful tariff hikes and increasing competition from satellite broadband providers, such as Elon Musk's Starlink.

  • Private telecom companies invested around Rs 70,000 crore in infrastructure to promote 5G.
  • 2 crore subscribers left their connections after a 10-26% price hike.
  • Private operators, including Reliance Jio, Bharti Airtel, and Vodafone Idea lost 2.6 crore customers.
  • BSNL gained around 68 customers as it did not increase prices.
  • The cumulative investment for 2024 by major telecom providers is approximately Rs 70,200 crore.
  • The satellite broadband market is creating competition for the telecom sector, with concerns over spectrum allocation.
  • Telecom operators need to balance tariff rationalization to recover investments while maintaining subscriber experience.
"The government cannot forget the '2G scam' -- a blot on the country's history." - Union Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia

The challenges from satellite providers and the fallout from tariff hikes complicate the telecom landscape, raising concerns about future investment and service quality.

item.title: Passengers Stranded In Mumbai As Flight Delayed For 16 Hours, IndiGo Responds - NDTV
item.description:
Passengers Stranded In Mumbai As Flight Delayed For 16 Hours, IndiGo Responds

Date: Recent

Source: Not specified

At least 100 Istanbul-bound passengers of an IndiGo flight are stranded at Mumbai's Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj International Airport due to a 16-hour delay caused by a technical glitch.

  • Flight 6E17 was scheduled to depart at 6:55am but is now set to take off at 11pm after multiple delays.
  • IndiGo has arranged an alternative aircraft and apologized for the inconvenience.
  • Passengers staged protests at the airport demanding refunds or alternative travel arrangements.
  • Several passengers voiced complaints on social media regarding the airline's handling of the situation.
“We regret that our flight 6E17... faced a delay due to technical issues.” - IndiGo
“The staff is extremely rude and refuse to answer any questions...” - Sonam Saigal

This incident highlights the frustrations faced by air travelers during unexpected delays and the need for better communication from airlines.
